Comment: From reporter Sara Boboltz:  The courts have already said Kilmar Abrego Garcia should come home. Now a judge says a 20-year-old man should be returned.      A federal judge ruled Wednesday that a second man must be returned from the El Salvador megaprison where he was hastily deported by President Donald Trump’s administration in March.  The man, referred to in court documents by the pseudonym Cristian, was among those swept up by immigration officials and flown to a brutal facility where inmates are told they will never leave.   Link to the full article: [https://www.huffpost.com/entry/trump-appointed-judge-orders-second-immigrant-returned-from-el-salvador-prison\_n\_680a562de4b0b3e1a66f06d3?utm\_medium=Social&utm\_source=reddit&utm\_campaign=us\_main](https://www.huffpost.com/entry/trump-appointed-judge-orders-second-immigrant-returned-from-el-salvador-prison_n_680a562de4b0b3e1a66f06d3?utm_medium=Social&utm_source=reddit&utm_campaign=us_main)
Author: huffpost

Comment: I worked for the government. The government makes mistakes all the time. Bad supervisors cover up mistakes in order to not face consequences. With any government action it is vital to have a review of the action outside of that agency. Why? Because other people within the agency will cover up for the bad supervisor rather than admit the mistake. Deporting people (Americans and immigrants) needs to be reviewed by a court. When mistakes are made, they must be corrected. No cover ups. Anyone whose okay with letting immigrants be deported without evidence and review is naive.

Comment: I would like to point out for the Trump voter conservative who likes to think of themselves as Christians (even when they are far from it) that might lurking in the shadows reading this thread that what you guys are doing is not what I believe Jesus would do.    My understanding of the Bible leads me to believe that Jesus would not look at a vulnerable immigrant who is lurking in the shadows minding their business and trying to make a living with half the minimum wage while being treated like an animal on the job (simply because their bosses can) just so that they can send money home for their parent or child's life saving surgery and say yup you deserve life in the death camp for this.    Magas can't decide whether Abrego is a gang member, gang leader or the cartel as long as it is a bad label that makes it hard for the public to defend him. No one is perfect, however, constantly voting for someone who will hurt as many people as possible who aren't you so that you can feel privileged watching other humans being shackled and treated like animals is just wrong.   I am a proud Christian, far from perfect, and definitely did not vote for Trump. This situation is hard to forgive when there is no end in sight in the destruction of the democracy, and the destruction to thousands if not millions of lives
